description.narrative: Mobilising More 4 Climate (MoMo4C) is a five-year program that aims to bring together entrepreneurs, firms, policymakers, investors and civil society organisations to make green business propositions that tackle the impacts and causes of climate change at a landscape level in developing countries, and to attract investments to implement these initiatives

title.narrative: Business cases for public and private investors

description.narrative: The strategic pillar “Business cases for public and private investors” attract investments and develop business cases for climate resilience and sustainable development projects that are embedded in landscape approaches. This strategy seeks to help improve business proposals, focussing on showing the economic and financial feasibility of the proposed activities, as well as seeking strategies to reduce the (perception of) risk by investors.
Business cases that have increased their reach within and beyond the MoMo4C landscape

title.narrative: Landscape investment plans by multi-stakeholder collaboration

description.narrative: Landscape investment plan researched by multi-stakeholder collaboration = 25% Landscape investment plan formulated by multi-stakeholder collaboration = 50% Landscape investment plan formally agreed upon by multi-stakeholder collaboration = 75% Landscape investment plan implemented by multi-stakeholder collaboration = 100%

title.narrative: # climate-resilient business plans made by entrepreneurs and companies in collaboration with NGOs

description.narrative: Written document(s) that describe(s) in detail how a business plan is going to become bankable and contribute to climate-resilient livelihoods

title.narrative: # outcomes achieved within outcome pillar Business cases

description.narrative: The strategic pillar “Enabling environment” aims to strengthen the conditions that enable climate resilience and sustainable development strategies consistent within the landscapes. A multi-stakeholder platform (MSP) is established in each landscape. This pillar in particular addresses the lack of climate awareness by different stakeholders by implementing self-assessments of climate vulnerability, analysis of financial flows and their impact on the objectives of the multi-stakeholder groups in the landscape. And definition of the climate action priorities for which additional finance will be necessary or for which barriers to finance need to be reduced.

title.narrative: # inclusive landscape climate action plans by multi-stakeholder collaboration

description.narrative: Multi-stakeholder collaboration active = 25% Landscape climate action plan formulated = 50% Landscape climate action plan formally agreed = 75% Landscape climate action plan implemented = 100%

title.narrative: # outcomes achieved within outcome pillar Enabling Environment

description.narrative: The strategic pillar “Harvesting lessons” is focused at investors, policymakers and NGOs involved in the identification and development of successful business cases. This strategy aims to strengthen the process of learning from the programme experiences by documenting these and by linking up with external knowledge generation centres to analyse and share the lessons learned.

title.narrative: # of times harvested lessons are shared

description.narrative: Sharing lessons learned externally in formal meetings, events, publications, articles, media, etc.

title.narrative: # landscape investment blueprints, tools and/or standards developed based on harvested lessons
# outcomes achieved within outcome pillar Lessons learned
